subject: Re: [junit] Signalling unsupported tests?
msgSnippet: You can write assumeTrue(someCondition()) at the beginning of any test, and the test will be skipped if someCondition() returns false.  You can also put it in
messageBody:
You can write assumeTrue(someCondition()) at the beginning of any test, and
the test will be skipped if someCondition() returns false. You can also
put it in a @BeforeClass method in order to skip an entire class if
someCondition() fails.

David
